text: Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Fantastyczne piwo, bardzo podobne do Dark Lorda. Gęste, oleiste. Czekolada, ciemne owoce, sos sojowy, melasa. Pyszne.
Milk chocolate, dense, dark fruits, an unbelievably drinkable 16% imperial stout. Big!

Bottle thanks to Douglas. 

A: OIly black, thin mocha head, and legs.

N: Leather, cocoa, tobacco, smoke, biscuit, intense brown sugar, molasses, oxidation, oak, caramel, vanilla, plenty of earth, and some soy sauce.

T: Very sweet and smokey. 

M: Heavy oily body, no alcohol, soft carbonation. 

O: This is very tasty - and its what I imagine people think Dark Lord tastes like. Theres just one thing thats holding me back from a higher score, but I cant quite put my finger on it.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2016 Bottle. 2013. Pours a cloudy brown with a tiny bubble of head. The aroma is massive sugary dark fruit. Amazing. Smoke, dark fruit essence, sugary hot but so drinkable. Massive smoky dark leather and tobacco. Amazing. The aroma is just so huge. Essence of dark fruit. Much like Expy, which is the best.

June 6, 2016. Bottle at home, vintage 2013. 
Black with a minimal brown head. Aroma is sweet, malty, sugary, slight boozy with raisins, prunes, figs, dark sugars, chocolate, alcohol, soy, vanilla, dark berries. Taste is sweet, boozy, slight bitter and salty. Finish is sweet and quite with salty licorice candy, some salty soy notes, sweet dark sugars, caramel, raisins, some milk chocolate, hints of ash, cocoa, blackberries. Full bodied, soft carbonation, oily texture. 
Sweet and salty.

Ive been saving this 2013-bottle for some time. Black and velvet-like. Creamy texture, thick. Amazing aroma with notes of coffee, dark chocolate, sirup. Sweetness and bitterness working great in unison. Almost overwhelming complexity. Best sipped and shared. Might get cloying if enjoyed in larger quantites. One to remember and dream about tasting again.

Bottle: Thanks Jdizzle: Served in a Chouffe glass: 2013 vintage:
Black beer with some brown bubbles...
Aromas roast, cacoa, chocolate, chocolate milk, toffee, caramel, dust and chalk...
Flavours of chocolate, spice, some roast, bitters, cacoa, raisin, brown sugars, chalk, toffee...
Aftertaste is bitter, roast, chocolate, spice and brown sugars.
Low carbo, watery mouthfeel, more than medium bodied.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle shared: black as night pour, little head or lacing. Aroma is deep dark fruits, char, roast, coffee. Flavor is a touch aggressive - a little too much bitter and charred/burnt grain. It would be better without that as it is almost balanced with sweeter malt and chocolate and bitter coffee, but not quite.

375 mL bottle poured into a snifter. 2013 bottle. Originally reviewed 9/8/2014. Black body. No head. A few bubbles. Very leggy.

Smells of fudge. Raisins. Deep roast. Booze.

Very dynamic stout flavors. Chocolate. Molasses. Fudge. Moves into deep roast. Bitter coffee and some burnt malts.
 Medium low carbonation. Very heavy and sweet.
 I was surprised by how good this is. More than just an over-sweet monster of a stout

Bottle shared by me @ 3/4 Dangerous Bottle Shares meets Moules Frites. Pitch black oily pour with small tan lacings. Nose has soy, chocolate and some licorice. Taste is sweet, a bit cloying, savoury notes. Licorice and dark chocolates on the backend.

Black body without much head.
Deep sweet with notes of chocolate and coffee.
Oily and well carbonated.

375ml bottle, ¿ Vintage, kindly shared by bursprak to the Aarhus Belgisk Blåmuslinger Tasting, 08/2015. - Finale to three big & bold postprandial closers to a nicely balanced tasting, this PoMo beer liqueur brings an elegant density of roast and black malt flavours into balance with the avantgarde of hop engineering: thick, destilled espresso and dark chocolate, orangeat, Grand Manier doused fondant over dried raisins, plums and DK-ubiquitous lakrids aka liquorice. Cognac-like alcohol never becomes sharply piercing, oozing prominently underneath the molasses. Hop bouquet subtleties stealthily flying under the dark surface: orange zest, berry, grape, citrus pith. Sticky, coating mouthfeel, without becoming sweet treacle. - Would be interesting to taste this parallel to some of De Struises more heavy hitters and compare the merits of clean engineering vs sugar-powered yeasts & eisbocking.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak! Pours pitch oily black. Aromas of dark sweet fruits, sweet licorice, bitter roast, molasses, malt, dark chocolate. Taste is molasses, sweet licorice, dark roast, sweet fruits, brown sugar, malt, chocolate.

375 ml bottle, thanks Staffan! Midnight black with no head. Aroma of prunes alcohol, boozy, roasted malt, cocoa nibs, dark chocolate, light coffee, chocolate cake and raisins. Taste is massive, boozy, chocolate, candy, cake, wood, vinous plums, raisins, dried fruits with a vinous liquor feeling. Liquid chocolate cake. Really nice

Beautiful dark brown head and not too carbonated. Thick as tar, can sense coffee, chocolate some herbs including a sense of anis.
On level with the absolute best beers in the world.

Bottle at James for a tasting with Ferris and Kraddel. Pours a deep dark black with a thin tan head. Big sweet roast, cocoa, chocolate, oxidized malt. Roast, sweet dark chocolate, cherries, old stone fruits. Incredibly sweet, but very tasty. Long meaty roast finish. Tasty.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2015 (Pronounced Mikkeller Kryds). Bottle shared with MF666 whose rating has my stamp of approval. Thick black pour with a minimal head. Molasses in the nose. The taste is heavy sweet and sticky with not that much bitterness to balance it, conceals the alcohol well. Medium/full body, near flat carbonation. Syrup, brown sugar, molasses, sweet chocolate, warming alcohol. Very sticky, but the alcohol picks it up a bit.

Black Black, nul skum, tyk i munden. Lidt syrlig gær agtig duft, 
Sød lidt bitter, bliver mahony med tiden

Kaffe eftersmag 

Free Føroyar!!!

Bottle shared thanks to richthevillan. Black beer with small head. Aroma of coffee, dark fruits and roasted malts. Taste is licorice, roasted malts, dark fruits, hops and some chocolate. Medium bodied and sticky.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from Mikkeller Webshop shared with SarkyNorthener; dark brown pour with a frothy light tan head, bourbon and roast malt aroma, taste has sweet chocolate action, light bourbon, vanilla, bitter finish, surprisingly thin mouthfeel.

2013, bouteille partagée. Je nai que peu de mots pour ce monstre dune puissance sans précédant. je suis mi-figue mi-raisin à savoir si jaime ou je déteste ce produit. Le nez est superbe, mais la bouche...bordel.

(Vintage 2013. 37.5 cl) Un liquide à la robe presque noire qui tombe dans mon verre et qui montre une viscosité certaine. Un petit col brun qui flotte pour quelques minutes. Le nez de cet impérial est richement décoré par le chocolat, la mélasse, la vanille, les fruits liquoreux et charnus, les malts enfumés et noirs, la réglisse, les oranges confites, les aiguilles de pin, le café et bien dautres choses. Des arômes qui sont pour le moins extrêmement complexes et qui, par cette superbe représentation, atteignent facilement ici le degré dit de «la perfection». Sur les papilles, cest la très grande joie. Lexpérience est grandiose et le choc, ravissant. Les saveurs noires sont fantastiquement fruitées. Ça va du raisin à la prune en passant par lorange et le citron. Les malts fournissent des appuis chocolatés riches mais contrôlés. Les notes mélangées de mélasse, de vanille, de houblons et de réglisse complimentent ma langue à chaque lampée. Ce tout est fantastique. En bouche, le liquide est liquoreux, faiblement collant, doucement remué par les bulles, habilement construit, très soyeux, velouté à souhait, complètement satiné, raffiné, plantureux. En finale, tout le meilleur des deux mondes : une montée mi-amère de chocolat et de café, modérément longue, parfumée par un alcool complètement fruité et fou.

375 ml bottle, 2013 version, from Mikkeller Webshop.
Pitch black body, with an almost inexistent, tan head.
Aroma of melting chocolate, coffee, toffee, vanilla, quite a lot of alcohol.
Wonderful, intense taste of coffee, chocolate, vanilla, wood, nuts, caramel, subtle zesty hops, some dark fruits, a lot of booze, but not as much as I expected.
Full, oily mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes warming, alcoholic, astringent, bitter-sweet, quite dry, very complex, with smooth coffee, dark chocolate, wood, quite a lot zesty hops again.

Very tasty! Relatively smooth to drink for this extreme ABV. Very complex of course, more in the taste than the nose in my opinion. Loads of different, yummy malt notes, I also like the subtle hops a lot.
This is the most expensive bottle I bought so far and its really delicious, but still not my favourite Imperial Stout from Mikkeller, their (much cheaper) Brunch Weasel stands out for me. So overall a bit overpriced maybe, but still a pleasure to try once.

2013 bottle. Pours thick black into a snifter. The little tiny bubbles take about 3 minutes to coalescealways a tense time. Nose is sweet, not as tar and molasses heavy as expected. A light meat-like savory note and something that keeps on saying "pancake batter". Makes me miss doing beer tastings. Despite all the heavy, sweet notes, the mouth really comes through with some interesting savory qualities -- well done bacon and salted meat mostly. Lots of maple syrup, marshmallow, "fig stock".  Finish becomes way too sugary. Body is very lightly carbonated, near flat. Doesnt bother me like it used to, though. As expected, it massive and too sweet, but it has some really interesting flavors going on. Not the legendary beer that I always thought the 2006 would be.
Bottle. Black pour with tan bubbles. Huge roasted and sweet aromas. Chocolate, toffee, caramel, vanilla, oak and other sweet flavors.

(Bottle) Pours black with a small brown head. The aroma holds vanilla, sticky brown sugar, milk chocolate, asphalt, warming alcohol, dried fruits, some coffee, blueberries and earthy, woodsy hops. The flavour is heavily sweet, medium bitter and light acidic with tones of milk chocolate, vanilla, asphalt, blueberries, dried fruits and earthy, woodsy hops. The mouthfeel is sticky, oily and soft with a low carbonation. Complex finish. Near full bodied.

2013 vintage, 375ml bottle, huge thanks to _angst_...thanks Alex! Pours a motor oil black, a few brown bubbles gather briefly, but this beauty lay still. Nice oily legs taboot. Aromas of chocolate syrup, fudge, vanilla, marshmallow, tobacco, cognac, oak and just a hint of alcohol. Wow. Taste is even smoother than the booze on the nose suggests! Loaded with a thick chocolate backbone....syrupy, fudge, chocolate chips....then a nice dark fruit character that blends into a vanilla/oak harmony. Hints of tabacco, leather, cognac, earth, roast and a slight maple sweetness makes this one go down very easily for the abv. Extremely impressed with this big guy. Even if it is a bit too much for me, it comes off with an elegance that imperial stouts of lower alcohol wish to achieve. Bravo!

375ml bottle at home. Black with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malty, chocolate and coffee, dark fruits, light alcoholic. Taste is sweet and light bitter, like the aroma, chocolate and coffee, light spicy (like cinnamon?). Medium to full body, soft carbonation. I had a sample (or two) of this beer in CBC 2013 and I think it was the best Imperial Stout of that festival!!

Backlog rating. Waxed bottle from Mikkeller and Friends. It pours a deep dark brown/black color with a minimal brown head. Aroma is big bold sweet and juicy, with notes of caramel, milk chocolate, lactose, vanilla, wood, cappuccino, fig jam. Taste is similarly sweet with a mild bitterness in the finish alongside notes of wood and alcohol. More chocolate, espresso, whisky and jam notes. Thick viscous body with soft carbonation. Overall, a monster of a sipper

2013 bottle graciously shared by Brett Dettler. Super heavy nose of roasted malt with black licorice, dark loamy soil, moderate phenols (a hint of burnt plastic), and a milk chocolate tone to finish. Pours clear dark brown with faint bubbles at the edge of the glass. Initial sharp taste of licorice, rum, and mild dark chocolate before the complex flavor quickly smooths out, bringing forth notes of velvety fudge-covered brownies, a hint of raisins and dates, brown sugar, and cocoa powder. A brief whisper of red chili flake emerges late. Incredibly smooth, slick texture, with a heavy body thats skews toward medium. The larger variety of malts helps create a delightful layered taste. Good stuff.
Sampled at RBSG. From notes. Loads of chocolate dominate. Vanilla, and Roasty malt back it up.

Bottle, 2013 vintage, 11/24/2014. Pours dark brown, nearly black, wispy tan head with a few larger bubbles around the edge of the glass. Aroma is liquid chocolate cake, fudge coming out as the beer warms, dark fruit well integrated, sherry-like notes, touch of oak, vanilla, some dark coffee and roast coming as an accent, not really balancing. Taste is sweet dark fruity chocolate liqueur, vanilla and caramel, dark roast bitterness cutting through the finish. Thick, liqueur-like body, ABV not showing much. Tasty stuff.

Bottle courtesy of Benh. Cheers pal. Always nice to taste a top 50 effort. This one is 43 at the time of writing. Pours Black with a tan head. A touch of sweetness buried under essentially savoury notes. Soy, leather, tobacco, wood and lashes of hot booze. I quite like a generous dose of booze in an imperial stout. This was extremely rich and rewarding. Delicious.

Bottle. Near black with tan head. Hot alcohol initially, leather, wood, chocolate. Taste is complex and rich, leather, fruity sherry dried fruit, verly little roastiness and quite fruity. Alcohol is fairly evident but not unpleasant.

Black brown pour with tan head and clinging lace. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, and nice roasted malt. Flavor is sweet chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, light abv, and a nice malt bitter finish. Medium/full bodied with good carbonation. very yummy

375ml white wax

Black with hints of ruby. No head, just some gurgles of bubbles.

Dark chocolate, dark fruits, oak, port, sweet chocolate. Thick, rich decedent nose. Smells like a 10% RIS. 
Sweet, sweeter, sweetest. Big full on taste. Roasted malt, tobacco, chocolate, port, oak, brown sugar, and caramel. 
Massive beer but subdued. Sweet but a sick good beer. One of his best efforts

Bottle - pours dark black. Lots of rich chocolate in the nose plus some notes anise and dates. The taste is a rich dark chocolate, some booze, and sweet. This is how I like my chocolate milk. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

375 ml bottle shared by ygtbsm94, thanks Brad! Pours a near still dark brown/near black with a rich caramel mahogany hue when backlit. Aroma is rich and complex - roasted malt, soy sauce, dark fruits, coffee bitterness, alcohol spice and muted alcohol. Flavor is same with a delicious round complexity that is somehow beyond description at this point in the tasting - 24 hours in. Like a coconut roundness - delicious. Mild carbonation, silky lactic mouthfeel, and roasty tobacco leaf finish.

Long time want. Thank you to ygtbsm94 for sharing. Brad, you are still the man.

The beer is dark brown with a broken, bubbly, beige head. Aromas of dark roast, distinctly European. Chocolates and roast. Booze, oak, Euro malt profile. Absolutely fantastic flavor. Instant 5. The best flavor of any Mikkeller beer I have yet had. Oh my. Ill never forget this beer - its that good.

Rating of bottle of 2006 version (16.0% abv). Bottle opened and original rating entered on Wednesday, June 20th, 2007.
Bottle... O-Town Pre-RBSG 07... This beer rocks!... Pitch black ale with a small, creamy, light brown head. Decent retention... ok, enough about the looks; lets dig in! First off, the ethanol wafting from the wide-rimmed glass stings my eyes as Im engulfed in an intoxicating, complex swirl of esters and phenols; malts and hops. A vinous, dark-spicy cloud surrounds me. Notes of port wine, tobacco, rawhide and smoked French oak with undertones of cocoa, horse blanket funk, dark raisins, dried plums and charcoal. The flavor make a U-Turn on the road toward complexity and instead, virtually screams chocolate, whiskey and hop bitterness. Overall  moderate lactic acidity, medium port sweetness and heavy, tannic, ashy bitterness. Full-bodied and velvety with adequate carbonation. Lengthy, astringent, almost-violently-bitter, bone-dry finish. Very, very warming! I tried, but couldnt describe my experience in fifty words or less. Thanks so much, Boboski, for sharing this world-class beer with me. A great friend and ambassador/proponent of the brewing arts!

2013 white wax bottle. Thanks Erik. Chocolate, vanilla, custard, dark fruit and a whole lot of cane sugar. Almost dark lord levels of sweetness. Only thing that brings this down is the complete lack of carbonation. Bottle didnt even hiss when I opened. A few bubbles when poured but no head. Really tasty stuff.

Bottle shared thanks to charule. Pours a clear dark brown that forms a slight head. Aromas arent your typical Mikkeller stout. Aromas of candy sugar, dark fruits, caramel. Taste is super sweet. Similar flavors to Thomas hardeys.
This one poured a murky dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of brown sugar, light roast and caramel. Flavor was lightly burnt brown sugar, chocolate, dark fruit and light roast. Good stuff.
Bottle from a trade. Poured black with thin to no head. Aroma is very sweet caramel. Light carb med bod. Quite sweet taste almost dark fruit.

375ml bottle, 2013. Black with niece head that disappears. Sweet calvados like, roasted malt, some molasses, chocolate, vanilla, some booze. Mild carbonation, full body, sweet, some sherry, great dessert beer.
Bottle during RBSG 2014 Grand Tasting at Schlafly Tap Room. Black with tan head. Aromas of peat, smoke. Tastes of chocolate, smoke, peat. Full body with a dry finish.
Bottle - Cocoa, mollasses, chocolate and some anise. Jet black with a thin beige head. Sweet, peat, coffee, chocolate and so much more. Smells good, tastes great.

Bottle shared by RobertDale at the RBSG grand tasting - thanks again, Bob, for making sure I got to try this! Pours an inky near-black color with no head. Looks dangerous. Notes of molasses, dark fruits, chocolate, caramel, vanilla, roasted malts, and soy. Full-bodied, with low carbonation and a smooth, oily mouthfeel. Sweet, but extremely balanced. Yeah, this is legit. Exceeded expectations.

Sampled at the RBSG14 Grand Tasting - Pours dark brown with a beige head. The aroma has heavy roast, soy, smoothness, oak, bittersweet chocolate and dark caramel. It has a very full rich smooth body with almost no carbonation. It starts off with rich chocolate, caramel, vanilla, sweetness and super smooth dark roastiness. The finish is very oily and really seems to tie all of the flavors together. Excellent beer in every way.
Bottle RBSG. Grand Tasting St. Louis. Huge thanks to RobertDale. Pours black with brown head. Nose/taste of roast and milk chocolate, oak, milk chocolate, sherry and chocolate liqueur. Full bodied.

Bottle with hella thanks to MrH for spearing this whale and sending it to America! Pours opaque black with a small dark brown head that dissipates fairly quickly leaving some lacing. Aroma is heavy duty chocolate, roasted malts, vanilla. Flavor is all of that plus some molasses and anise, tons of vanilla and chocolate. Very sweet, light bitter. Full body, creamy mouthfeel, very little sign of the massive ABV. More of a desert liquor than a beer really, but nice nonetheless.
Black color, no foam. Aroma of vanilla, semi sweet chocolate, some alcohol. Sweet, tootsie roll chocolate, a dose of roasty bitterness, hint of maple. Alcohol not strongly present.
Sampled at Grand Tasting during RBSG. Pours a black color with white head. Roasty, thick malty syrupy flavors.
Bottle shared at SRBG 2014. Pours a thick black with a decent tan head. Aroma of chocolate, malt, and vanilla. Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate, vanilla, molasses, and dark fruit. Excellent.
Small bottle thanks bob. Just gooey black mass. HEavy sweetness and booze, oxidation setting in. ehh.

Black no head, still. Aroma is bright dark fruits, chocolate, spirit. Taste is so sweet! Sweet candied sauce. Low carbonation. Dark fruits bursting out. Mild spice, vanilla, bourbonish. Finish is is bit sickly. Overall, this is very much in the vein of the brew dog stouts - syrupy - which is far from my favourite example of the style.

Bottle @ RBSG Grand Tasting. Pours a black appearance with a brown head. Licorice, dark chocolate, plum, fig aroma. A bit goopy and sweet but fucking delicious, spicy, cinnamon / nutmeg, brown sugar, caramel, fig flavor. Lots of spiciness. Great beer.
RBWG-GT-shared by RobertDale thanks!-disappearing brown-black. A-roasty/molasses-dk malt. T-follows. smooth/silky.

Tasted at RBSG grand tasting. 11.2oz waxed bottle. 2013 bottle. Very dark brown color. Thin bubbly white head. Some dark chocolate, roast, coffee in the nose. Very nice big punchy flavor, some vanilla. Moderate sweet taste.. Light bitter. Hides alcohol exceptionally well. Light sticky texture. Bigger body, kind of chewy. Lots of people are saying sherry-like, I get some of that. Good stuff.

Woodshed 3.0! Sample courtesy of BOLTZ7555, hot damn, thanks Jason. I have been wanting to try this since years and years. Bottle pours with a dark mahogany looking body that supports a thin tan head. The modest aroma offers up chocolate, molasses, mild dark roasted maltiness, a slight burnt malt note and then more and more chocolate mixed with marshmallows. Aroma seems timid but pretty nice. The taste however isnt timid and doesnt mess around. I get smooth sweet residual sugar notes, smooth sweetened dark roasted malts, chocolate fudge brownie, rich nectar like chocolate goodness and molasses sweetened rich yummy coffee. Wow! This flavor is MONEY! This ends with me only wanting more as I get smooth slowing fading chocolate and nectar like residual burnt sugars with very little sense of the massive ABV. Goodness.
Pretty dark. Not completely black. Smells like sweet chocolate chip cookies. So sweet, super intense. Not boozy at all though. Quite smooth, oily and not carbonated. Smooth finish but way too sweet

375 ml bottle thanks to Adam. 2013 vintage. Aroma is brunt molasses, sugar, brownie batter and a hint of vanilla. Kind of like a brownie dipped in alcohol. A swirl in the snifter shows a real oily film around the glass. 
Body is thick with a texture of whipped cake batter yet with the above mentioned oily viscosity. Dark roasted chocolate, burnt espresso bean, light old vanilla and prunes with some notes of pumpernickel bread. Full body and even with the huge ABV it is still rather easy to drink. Massive Impy stout that will slap you in the face and you will ask for more. Pretty impressive.
On tap at Fermentoren. Dominated by coffee, vanilla, burnt caramel, dark spices, herbs and oak. Overpowering to say the least.

Bottle on an Antwerpen park bench. Opaque black pour with creamy tan brown head. Aroma is really chocolaty, ghy (input from a 3 year old), tons of vanilla and chocolate, so rich and desserty. Taste is sweet, really chocolaty, cocoa, light molasses vanilla, nice roastiness to balance, a really tasty bomb. Palate is damn near perfect, really thick and chewy but not cloying or boozy, nice carbonation. Really good.

Bottle (375 ml). Shared by JulienHuxley, thanks! While we were drinking this one in an Antwerp park, theres was a bunch of teenagers shotgunning cans of a cheap local pale lager. It was quite funny that our 375 ml bottle was way more expensive than their five cases of beers. The beers is pitch black and thick with a small persistent beige/brown head and light lacing. Aroma is rich and complex with loads of molasses, red fruits, chocolate/fudge, vanilla, roasted malt, boozy notes and light soy sauce. Taste is also super rich, moderately sweet with again a ton of molasses, fudge, red fruits, vanilla, roasted malt and a warming finish. Full (!) body. Moderate carbonation. Thick and liquorous mouthfeel. Probably my favorite stout from Mikkeller (and one of my favorite stouts). Super rich, complex and warming. The alcohol isnt too much even at 16% abv. A great sipper!

Pours a surprisingly clear brown color. Settles blackish in the glass with a tiny beige head. Nose: mercy me.. Im such a sucker for this cakey style. Loads of toffee and brownie. Coconut and rhum juice. The taste is like a wet dream if youre a sweet tooth. French vanilla butter pecan chocolate deluxe! Good booze, Oily texture, sticky and candied finish. In the end a very sexy baverage..

Still dark pour mild carbonation dark pour aromas fudge mocha like coffee dark chocolate liquorice raisin prune caramel notes the flavours coffee so good caramel medium bitter flavours wipe out the alcohol strength note raisin taste dark chocolate crisp hops citrus cocoa simply delicious stuff the finish best tastes well just a wonderful imperial not too many faults the coffee and fruit were probably the best of a good lot of tastes marvellous imperial

Bottle from SJ. Holy crap this is awesome! 

Mega notes of hop, citrus, roast, dark fruit and chocolate. Bold black pour, thin head. Goes down smooth and just satisfying. Well done!

Bottle @ 10K + OT. Thanks to Erik for getting me this bottle. Black pour with no head and impressive viscosity. Quite sweet. Candied nuts, vanilla, dates, and raisins. A bit of ash and lots of graham cracker. Almost whiskey-like. Taste is big on the dark fruit sweetness. Tons of date, raisin, and plum. Maple syrup, a bit of soy sauce, vanilla, and graham cracker. Some roasted malt, a hint of bitterness and alcohol. Not usually my thing, but I quite enjoyed this.
Keg at the Mikkeller and fiends bar... Deep black... Thin tan head... Dark meaty malts... Dark roast... Sweet chocolate... Soft rich malts chewy roast... Heavy sweet malts... Light dry bitter finnish

> An excessively sweet ASA/barleywine 
[ Bottle ][ brokensail ][ 375ml ][ 10K+OT Tasting ][ Stemless Wine Taster ][ 5/3/14 ]
>> Thank you Andrew for the share! Clear sepia brown, no foam. Nose is brown alcohol, ginger, soy, Marmite, smoke, dark cherry. Taste is brown sugar, paper, tootsie roll, long soy and bitter toffee and ginger peel flavor. Huge brown sugar with peanut brittle. Uhh. Not RIS, more like barleywine or ASA.
>!< sweet, not RIS, soy, marmite

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends. Vintage 2014, 14.9%. Aroma has truffles, dark chocolate, some deep roastiness and coffee. Flavour has lots of salty licorice, some herbal tones and coffee. So salty and herbal that I almost can taste nothing else. Hides the ABV very well, unbelievable that this has almost 15%.

Tap at Mikkeller&Friends. Black pour, small tan film. Aroma is dark, coffee and black currant. Sticky, syrupy mouthfeel. Very sugary, more black currant with sharp, bitter zing. Heavy, tough, but fascinating.

Bottled acquired from the Mikkeller Bottle Shop. Thick, syrupy squid ink pour with a small mocha head that diminished to a ring quickly. Massive molasses, maple, vanilla bean, brown sugar, rum-soaked raisins, plums, candied yams, marshmallow, and licorice. Cloyingly sweet. Sticks to the roof of your mouth like peanut butter. Stays with you well after you clear the debris. Not sure why this one is highly prized.

Bottle shared at Dunts Tasting (Chicago, IL). Pours a rich deep blackish hue, dark and ominous with nice gentle brownish glow on the edges. Frothy brown head dies down quickly, laces small. Aromas are cocoa, fudge, firm dry and toast elements, some firm hops, dry and bitter with gentle nibs, roasty malts and caramel. Initial is firm and thicker bodied, rich cocoia and caramel, touches of nib, firm roast and dryness. Middle is fudgey, some firm dryness and roast, big nib character. A rich dryness and roast. Some nice flavors show some rich nib and dryness, roast and cocoa. Finish is really damn good, roasty and nib driven, coffee. Elements are rich and potent, but still work well together. Fantastic stuff. Rich, big, flavorful and still quite approachable. Not just a sweet sticky messy, integrating a range of flavors, assertive power and good play between that rich cocoa nib, espresso and roasty elements. Really nice stuff.

bottle, 2013 version. very, very dark, very smooth brown head. Aroma of hard roasted malts, sugar, dried dark fruits,licorice. quite complex aroma. Flavor is very sweet, roasted malts, licorice, chocolate, warming feeling due to the high alc. , quite smooth, slighlty weird bitterness, the high alc. seems to play in here in a not-so-elegant way. aftertaste s alc and roasted malts.

Bottle shared at Scopeys 5000th rate. Thanks to basically all of us for chipping in but mainly cheers to Paul for being on the look out and ordering this monster. A very murky, dark brown pour with no head. Nose is huge and sweet raisins, heavy sultana/prune, a big oaky vanilla presence, liquorice, spice and milk chocolate. Quite sweet and juicy (dark fruits). Big spice reminding me of bourbon barreled RISs, stewed prunes and raisins - very juicy, brown sugar, vanilla, quite woody and ashy and a nice dose of currants. Drinks very well for the ABV but is a touch thin and sweet. Has a pleasing kick of booze on the finish. Probably too sweet but drinks decently. Kind of reminds me halfway between a big ass stout and a barley wine. A lot of dark fruit focus. I wouldnt be putting this in the top 50 beers on ratebeer but it should age quite gracefully. Solid stuff

Bottle split at Scopeys 5K Extravaganza of Oompah Band meets doorbell music, thanks to Ken, Josh, Paul and myself but most of all Paul cos it was his day and he ordered it - 15/02/14.
Light black with moderate tan edgeing.
Nose is dark dark chocolate, light booze, chocolate biscuits, molasses, chocolate maltesers, earthy hop backnotes, burnt sugars.
Taste comprises dark chocolate, dark fruits, molasses, burnt toffee, light smoke, brown sugars, dark toffee fudge, lickobooze.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, sweet closure but not OTT, lightly warming close. 
Solid big ABV impy, alcohol pretty well integrated for the ABV, but not top 50 for me.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from Mikkeller beer shop. It pours opaque black with a small bubbly tan head. The nose is rich roast, tangy dark fruits, milk chocolate, black currant jam, umami and salted caramel. The taste is sweet, oily, chocolate, treacle, toast, fudge, toffee, brown sugar, candy, cherry brandy, alcohol, chocolate gateaux with a sweet, oily finish. Full body, fine carbonation and oily mouth-feel. Big, rich and oily. A bit sweet and cloying for my liking, but a flavoursome beer anyhow.

Aroma: intense hops, some chocolate and citrus fruits. Appearance: black, small brown creamy head. Taste: heavy sweet. Palate: roasted flavours, sweet, ripe dark fruits. Overall: massive Imperial Stout, very complex aromas and flavours. Bottle at the Craft Beer Co. Clerkenwell, London.

Pours a semi pitch black with almost no head. Aroma is big fat and sticky and has a characteristic smell of raw sugar canes, medicine, raw cocoa powder, soy, raisins, dates, chocolate, sweet liquorice, earthy coffee, motor oil and actually a nice balance overall. Taste of sweet liquorice, dark chocolate, brown sugar, dark sweet fruits, candied apple, medicine, soy and molasses. Very sweet beer - big fat sticky monster!

Pour is pretty darn black, with a "thick" reddish hue, and virtually no head. 
Aroma brings quite a lot of cocoa powder, along with boozy raisins, dried dark fruits, some "green" hoppy notes, slight roasted coffee, ever so slightly roasted malts, sugar canes, molasses, toffee, sweet licorice, soy-like notes, burnt sugar. This is almost like if a "Mikkeller black" mated with a lbv port. 
The taste is pretty darn sweet, with faint bitter notes. Pretty darn slick, slick and full bodied, with a flat carbonation. (that suits this brew marvelously)
Thanks again to my boys, aka. Niels and Rasmus. Aka Niller and Ralle. Aka. Monoking and Mr. O double T for sharing this..

Pours oily, sticky, transparent black. Looks like coke without bubbles. Almost no head. The aroma is very sweet and boozy. Like cough syrup. I feel frightened! Taste has this brown sugar thing. Not just sweet, but the taste of (burned) sugar. Lots of raw cocoa, soy, coffee, raisins, cognac, slight sweet licorice. Very massive, sticky and tasty.
Bottle @ tasting. Aroma is huge roast, liquorice, vanilla, molasses, sugar, plums, tar etc. Flavour is whick sweet liquorice vanilla molasses tar roast madness.

2013 bottle, excellent Euro hipster packaging, lucky it arrived in one piece...oil black, slight dark brown head on the pour, fast dissipation... the aroma is strong brownie with bourbon, pretty nice... the taste is diabetic sweet, lots of bourbon, no typical danish char, unlike any other Euro stout Ive had, reminds me of an American stout, I get the hi European ratings, reminds me of a ba dark lord...good not great

375ml bottle, thanks to Jason.

Pours black, tan head, thin ring with some wisps on top. Smell is sweet...very sweet, actually. Light booze, oak, bakers chocolate, burnt sugars. Flavor is ridiculously sweet, chocolate, a little more booze here, caramel. Very decedent. Full body, light carb, creamy rich finish.

Overall, a very sweet, rich, and decedent stout. Not quite as good as previous rates suggest, but still a nice monster to sip on.

---Rated via Im awesome and youre not.

Poured deep, deep dark brown/black with no head, heavy oily pour. Aroma is a glorious mixture of roast malt, dry, alcohol soaked fruit, dark chcoolate, vanilla and dark roast coffee. Full body, vanilla smoothness leading to a flavour that is a more three dimensional version of the aroma. Utterly gorgeous.

37.5 cl bottle @ home. Pours pitch black with a small tan head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are chocolate, tobacco, dark fruits, vanilla, coffee, and roasted malt. ABV is pretty well hidden.

Bottle @ Deans Winter Shelter Tasting, courtesy of kermis, 2013 edition. Many thnx for sharing this beauty. Pours a midnight black beer with virtually no head whatsoever. Aroma is alcohol, bourbon, booze, coffee, vanilla and caramel, all blended together in one of the most awesome aromas Ive ever tried. Flavor is very sweet, much vanilla and caramel going on, alongside big molasses, licorice and dry roasted malts. Awesome balance. Long, cloying sweet aftertaste. One word.. WOW.. this defintely lives up to its reputation.

Bottle at Deans Winter Shelter Tasting. Poured a murky dark mahogany with a round bubbly tan head. The aroma is rich fruit liquorice vanilla. The flavour is medium to strong bitter moderate sweet with a super rich smooth liqourice fruit vanilla roast malt dark chocolate palate. Fully bodied with flat carbonation and a big oily mouthfeel. Truly amazing.

Black as it can be with almost head. Smells of deep dark delicious, dark roast, a bit of bourbon barrel, chocolate, espresso and deep delicious malt. Full oily smooth body. Tastes of deep chocolate cake, vanilla, thick and delicious. It finishes with deep chocolate sweetness. Amazing, just amazing.

Sampled from bottle @ Deans Winter Shelter Tasting. Thanks kermis! Opaque pitch black color, virtually no head. Aroma has malts, some sweetness, lightly wood, loads off vanilla. Taste malts, chocolate, lightly sweetness, wood, lots of vanilla again, decently bitter. Lovely beer but for me too much vanilla.

Sample @ THT tasting courtesy of Kermis. Big thanks
Thin head. Clear black pour. Low carbonation. An awesome brew.

Bottle at Deans Winter Shelter Tasting @ ABCBeers. Black pour. Aroma is full of roasted malts, bourbon, leather, chocolate, caramel and creamy. Flavor is very full bodied, roasted, chocolate and quite sweet but very well balanced and amazingly drinkable. Lovely brew.

Thnx a lot to bobochamps . 
Pours black , no head 
Smell is oat , bit booze , coffee bitterness 
Low carbo . 
Taste is chocolate , oak , bit bitter ,syrupy, some coffee , sticky mouthfeel . Bit boozy finish . Very sweet

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2014 Flaska. Delar med Isabel och avslutar födelsedagen. Hade glömt bort den här rackaren när jag dyker ner i källaren för att rota fram något att avsluta kvällen med. Minst ett topp-50 kryss lär man ju bocka av när man fyller år. Förväntningarna var dock inte så höga med tanke på att Mikkeller aldrig riktigt imponerat på mig på så vis att jag ramlat av stolen i häpnad av ölperfektion. Den här känns dessutom mest som en kul experimetbärs. Men ack så fel jag hade. Helt fantastisk och underbar. Förmodligen passade det perfekt med att vi redan druckit en hel del innan och trubbat av smaklökarna lite för alkoholen är inte det minsta spritig. Ovanligt mycket fikon och dadlar i doften. Smaken kan nog mest liknas vid flytande choklad och ren kakao. Blytung men samtidigt i bra balans. Påminner mig mest om Chocolate Rain men utan bourbon (Inte testat Black Tuesday ännu, troligen mer lik den då kanske). Ingen slurry. Tveklöst det bästa Mikkeller gjort. Och det vågar jag påstå eftersom jag testat allt från Mikkeller...


-----        
Rerate: Torkade frukter dominerar denna härliga imp-stout. Fin sötma i balans. Fikon, russin och dadlar. Tung och riktigt bra. Håller lätt många år till. Inga tecken till att ha åldrats. Skulle kunna fungera till en snygg efterrätt med tex tryffel eller annan kul choklad.

38cl, Vintage 2013, at 16%Vol, as Mikkeller X Imperial Stout, exclusive Danish brew, thx alot to Mikkel and team!, very complex sweet Stout, roasted/sweet and slightly alcoholic/fruity, yet not too heavy, very balanced, cloudy, nearly no head, top class!, WOW!, Another masterpiece from Mikkeller... Respect!

Dark brown opaque color, small brown head. Whisky, bourbon in the nose. Alcoholic. Full-bodied. Very sweet, some vanilla, alcohol, licorice. Much going on but certainly too sweet now.
Black, brown head. Chocolate and fudge. Sweet chocolate toffee. Bitterness builds in finish. Sweetness builds with an alcohol burn

14-NOV-2013, draft @Mikkeller, Black Sensation night.
Black with high tan head.
Aroma is cocoa. Very sweet.
Taste is cocoa as well. Other stuff reveals itself after a while but cocoa still dominant. Coffee and chocolate plus alcohol.
Extremely sweet, extremely full body. Too sweet in the long run but fantastic.

Pours black with thick tan head. Aroma of cocos, vanilla, chocolate, brown sugar. Taste is ice latte FFS! Tons of coffee, milk, vanilla, milk chocolate, some roasted malt. Body is rich and milk creamy. Yum!

Bottled. Pours pitch black with a small, lacing tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and Vanilla. Sweet flavor that ends up with some bitterness and an alcohol bite. Medium to full bodied, oily text. and soft carb. A great impy.

Pitch black. Soy sauce and dark fruit dominated aroma with heavy roasted malts and cold old coffe. Flavor is insanely heavy and sweet with roasted coffe notes barley balacning the sugary sweetness. Smooth bodied nice sipper indeed but more sugary and extreme than sophisticated and complex.

1-2 year aged bottle of this got busted out at a tasting years ago. I cant remember specifics at this point except that the 5 or 6 of us that were there were rather impressed how all these different flavors somehow blended as well as they did. Definitely recommend aging it for at least a year or two.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2015 Sample at CBC 2013, Saturday. Black with a creamy tan head. What a great beer this is! Incredible smooth and drinkable. Heavy but soft in the same time. Cocoa, vanilla, some coffee, roasted malt and syryp. Sweet but very, very nice! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Medium full body, very smooth and creamy, fine bubbled carbonation, Rich and decadent flavors, incredibly smooth feel.

CBC - Red Session, Østerbro, Copenhagen, DK.
Tap, 050513.
Black with beige head. Aroma of roasted malt. Flavor with caramel, coffee, chocolate and smooth palate

Sample at CBC 2013.

Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, alcohol and fruity notes.

Tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013 - Session II. Pours oily black with a strong, brown foam cap. Lots of syrupy chocolate in the aroma, some vanilla. Hugely sweet flavor, lots of chocolate candies, burnt sugar, vanilla cream. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Syrupy. Moderately warming finish, tons of sticky dark sugars, more chocolate syrup. Rich, very, very, very sweet. Decadent stuff but getting through more than a few ounces would be a chore.

One hell of an Imperial Stout on tap at Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade. THe pour is a completely opaque black with a dark tan or brown head floating atop creamy and dense. The aroma is outstanding and almost too intense with big alcohol whiffs and a huge coffee and espresso aroma. The flavour has a hint of brown sugar sweetness with a bit of dark chocolate flavours before the intense roast and robust roasted espresso beans take over towards the finish. This is an intense beer with an awesome coffee flavour but despite that, the mouthfeel is silken smooth and creamy. This is a pure delight!

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2014 4th May 2013CBC. Great to finally catch up with this beast! Opaque black beer, big tan head. Palate is soft and surprisingly light. Very sweet dark malt. Touches of wood and lactose. Sweet coffee. Semi dry finish. A super rich sweet treat. Bottle at Scopeys 5K. Sweet rich chocolate and dark chocolate. Nice jammy fruits and a little coffee. Very light touch of spice. Drinking well below the abv.

Black with a light brown, lasting head. Overwhelming aroma, fresh hops, tobacco, citrus and flowers. Sharp bitterness attack, with some alcohol presence. 4.3
2013 The Remake: Lots and lots of cocoa powder, along with dark chocolate and plenty of alcohol. Sugary sweet flavour with cane sugar and cocoa powder

Draught @ CBC 2013. Pours black with a good lasting light brown head. Aroma is is very sweet with vanilla, roasted malt, muscovado sugar, toffee, fudge, chocolate, espresso, complex dark fruit and cocoa. Taste is heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Body is full+, texture is thick, syrupy/smooth, carbonation is soft. Finish is long, complex and warming. Over the top niceness in a bottle.

Tap @ CBC 2013. The pours black with a tight tan head. Pretty attractive pour. The nose is very, very sweet. Loads of glazed donut. Burnt brown sugar. Lactose. Coffee cake. Chocolate fudge. The taste is vanilla, toffee. Sweet milk chocolate. Quite sugary, a bit hot. Oily body, thick. Decent, but a couple of ounces is plenty.
Pours black with a light brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, cocoa powder, chocolate, vanilla and light coffee. Flavour is roasted malt, cocoa, chocolate and vanilla. Very sweet and to much cocoa.

Draught @ CBC2013. Pours oily pitch black with a small creamy mocha head that slowly dissipates while leaving lots of creamy lacing on the glass. Smell is sweet and malty with roasted malts, caramel, burnt cookies, toffee, charred wood, minerals, butterscotch hard candy, sweetened dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, alcohol and hints of roasted nuts, dried dark fruits and smoke. Taste is very sweet, bitter and malty with roasted malts, sweetened dark roast coffee, burnt caramel, dried dark fruits, dark chocolate and alcohol. Mouthfeel is round, oily, boozy sticky sweet and full bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with roasted malts, dried dark fruits, dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, wood, alcohol and hints of roasted nuts and port wine. Pretty good but way to sweet to be really good...
On tap @ CBC 2013. Dark brown with a small brown head. Malty with chocolate tones. malt, chocolate, fruit and sweetness. Full body with a long, bitter sweet after taste.

[5/4/13] Draught at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013. Black with a beautiful brown head, big and creamy. Big aroma, pretty alcoholic, with coffee liqueur and dark chocolate. Big sweet chocolate flavor with some espresso with sugar and some alcohol. Full-bodied, thick and silky. Wonderful.

Sample from tap, CBC 2013. Pitch black with a creamy, tan head. Sweet aroma with rich roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, vanilla, licorice, brown sugar and bread. Hints of tar and soy sauce. Taste is heavy sweet. Full body, thick feel. Finishes heavy sweet and roasted with coffee, alcohol and fat, creamy milk chocolate. This beer is so thick, so vulgar and rich it´s almost unbearable. Glad I only had a sample... Excellent experience.
CBC. Black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla and alcohol. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Very sweet and rather bitter finish. Soft and smooth. 040513

Draught @ CBC. Pours black with a big creamy light brown head. Aroma of rich roasted malt, coffee, licorice, dark chocolate. Flavor is rich roasted malt, dark roasted coffeebean, both dark and milk chocolate, bitter cocoa, some booze. Full body, creamy mouthfeel, average carbonation, nicely warming alcohol in the finish. Nice balanced and tasty beer. 040513
Tap @ CBC. Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate and coffee. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, medium sweet, liquorice, hops, medium bitter and thick.

Sample at CBC 2013, Saturday.

Black with a creamy tan head. What a great beer this is! Incredible smooth and drinkable. Heavy but soft in the same time. Cocoa, vanilla, some coffee, roasted malt and syryp. Sweet but very, very nice!

Draught at CBC.
Pours black and heavy.
Sweet chocolatey, coco liqour and vanilla sugar.
On tap at CBC. Black colour with small off-white head. Roasted and vanilla aroma. Intense chocolate taste, also roasted and coffee taste. Sweet.
Sample at CBC 2013. Massive amount of sweet syrup, roasted chocolate and syrup. One of my favorites of the festival.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2013 Tap @ CBC 2013. Pours black with a creamy head. Roast, prune, raisin and sugars. Massive cocoa powder as well. Dry and bitter. Warming.. quite hot actually. Too young and not anywhere near the ratings people are giving.

Sample @ CBC. Pours black with a beige head. Very nice and sweet aroma with notes of vanilla, powdersugar, toasted marshmallows chocolate and a small touch of coffee. Taste is sweet ans has got a vinous quality. Notes of Oboy, muscavadosugar and toasted marshmallows. Well made. Taste is maybe a little too sweet... but hey! Its a great beer.
A massive imperial stout served at CBC2013. One of the best at the festival, just incredible considering the size. Loads of vanilla and sweetness, some roast and syrup. Awesome
(Short review due to the massive amounts of beer I drank during the CBC13.) One of the highlights of this years CBC. So smooth and flavourful. Very nice!

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2013 Tap at CBC 2013 and bottle rerated in December 2013. Pours black with a small beige head.  Aroma of fudge, chocolate, like a sweet chocolate milkshake with toffee, vanilla, molasses, coffee and roasted malts.  Flavor is very heavy sweet and moderate bitter.  Full bodied with flat carbonation.

Draught at CBC 2013. Pitch black beer with a nice beige head. Chocolate and licorice aroma, vanilla, figs, creamy, chocolate, cocoa powder, soot, prunes, sweetish, some woody notes. Sweetish chocolate flavor, raisins, figs, caramel, toffee, lots of alcohol. Great beer!

Sample @ CBC13.
Pours deep dark red, almost black color with a small head. Aroma is mostly cocoa, some mild toasted malts and chocolate. Flavor of tar, syrup, cocoa, caramel malts, some soy, sweet malts and molasses. Very nice on the nose but the flavor is way too sweet and sugary.
7325

Pours black with thick tan head. Aroma of cocos, vanilla, chocolate, brown sugar. Taste is ice latte FFS! Tons of coffee, milk, vanilla, milk chocolate, some roasted malt. Body is rich and milk creamy. Yum!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark with low brown head
Aromas loaded with cocoa, vanilla, coffee, chocolate
Fuckin amazing! Iced latte with loads of caramel malts

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nose is crazy amounts of dark sugars, cocoa, vanilla. Taste is the same with some herbal notes and coffee. Crazy sweet, 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ CBC2013. Pours a pitch black colour with a beige head. Aroma is very rich with mudcake, roasted malts and bread. Flavour is very rich as well with mudcake, raisins, roasted malts, wood and some soy sauce. Full bodied, oily mouthfeel and a warming, roasty, rich finish. Soy sauce notes ruin a bit, but otherwise a great rich beer.

Draught @ CBC 2013
Pours pitch black with a smooth head. Aroma of sweet syrupy notes, coffee, roasty malts, cocoa, vanilla and ash. Taste is sweet and sticky with loads of grainy roasty malts, cocoa, ash and vanilla. Finish is sweet and roasty with some syrupy notes and hints of cocoa, sugary vanilla and coffee. Quite massive and over the top IS. Too much of everything, not very balanced.

Tap. Pours jet black with a creamy dense brown head. The aroma is chocolate, oranges, hard roasted malt and sweet fruit. The flavor is sweet roasted, oranges, candy, sweet chocolate and dark berries. Loads of sweetness in this. Complex as hell.

Pours dark brown black with a small creamy brownish head. Aroma is sweet milk chocolate fullbodied vanilla coffee a bit boozy. Flavor is velvety sweet fulbodied nicely bitter a bit pungent coffee chocolate. Good tasty finidh.
Rich, rosted coffee and port.  Heaven!  Big drink, sip it slowly and enjoy all the flavour.  Wish I could try this one again.
Bottle. Pours black. Yup. Nose is weird and cool I think, a little sour but lots of sweet malty stuff, too. Flavor is also weird but cool. Drinks easily enough despite the alcohol. Neat.

big huge thanks to greg for obtaining this bottle.  big thanks to Dak for inviting me to this highly insane tasting.  This is the most perfect beer that i have ever had to date.  I would gladly fly to the end of the earth for this beer again.  poured an amazingly beautiful black with a copper head.  aroma was dark fruits, chocolate, fudge, earth, and cinnamon.  flavor was equally as impressive with fudge, earth, dark roast, dark fruit, and a spicy quality that really stood out and wowed me.  body was insanely rich and smooth.  I am seriously humbled by this beer and the chance to drink it.  those tampa guys rock and really know how to show an out-of-towner a great tasting.  oh yeah and this is rating 2000 baby!!!

Glad to have come across this one even more glad that there was such a cool group of guys that helped me land it.

A:  Pours a nice rich deep dark black hue with a nice mocha colored head.  Some retention and a bit of lace.

S:  Rich and sweet.  Notes of chocolate and dark fruits.  Hints of roast with rich candy like tones.

T:  Rich and earthy.  Roast and deep dark fruits.  A mild tone of sourness hides beneath chocolate.  Hints of mild smoke and a touch of booze.

M:  Full bodied, rich and roasty.

NUMBER 400, WHAT??  Huge tip of the cap to Greg for landing this bottle!!!  Joan Jett black pour with a tan head.  The nose is crazy with dark fruit, chocolate, and funk aromas.  The taste to me was more like a barley wine than an imperial stout.  Dark fruit, lacto, cherry, green apple, cinnamon and other spices.  What a mad blend.  AWESOME...
Black pour. Tart dark fruit aroma, chocolate, funk, Brett, raisins. Port like flavor with a cocoa powder, tart fruit and crazy funk. What an insanely cool beer!

Bottle courtesy of the Friendly Officer. Pours a dark, opaque black with very little head. Nose of black currant, Chocolate fudge, plum and mild funk. Strange brew but it works in great harmony. Palate follows in-step with nose, funkiness is a bit more aparent with sweet backround tartness. Finishes slowly but cleanly. Excellent beer

On tap at Copenhagen Oldage on 20 May 2006. Looks great - pitch black with a lasting tan head. Completely opaque. Massively hoppy aroma for an imperial stout. Didnt really pick up much lacto there but it certainly comes through as an accent on the palate. Probably just as an accent because everything else is so big. Tar, chocolate, coffee, prunes, raisins, burnt toast, kitchen sink etc etc. Immensely rich but perhaps its the lacto that keeps it from being too much. If I have to pick a hole its probably thats its a little too sweet for my taste - personal preference only.

Thanks Jason for sharing this beer.  The beer pours to a pitch black body with a thin iced tea head.  The aroma is deep and complex.  Thomas Hardys Ale-like.  Grapes, port wine, chocolate, light leather.  The flavor is complex with light chocolate, deep port wine, maple or bourbon barrels, and a light tangyness. Charred black malts.  The palate is tangy and medium-full bodied.  I liked it.

Bottle, thanks to Mads, BB 2050.  Drinking to celebrate the birth of my daughter!  Poured deep brown, near black, with a short, tight cap of tan head.  The aroma was all over the place.. Brett and lactic funkage struck first (and I didnt expect em b/c I didnt read the description) with bakers chocolate, molasses, and licorice behind.. deep and malty with warmth on the back (but the heat didnt take over).  The flavor opened with tangy oak and funky notes with the syrupy warm malts behind (molasses, licorice, and a blend of chocolates).. more funky on the back end, and a touch metallic there.  Heavily-bodied with low, tight carbonation on the palate.. warm, but not too abrasive considering the ABV.. very good and intriguing, but there was too much going on.

Bottle. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate, coffee and licorice aroma. Roasted malty dark bitter chocolate, coffee and licorice flavor. Has a long warming roasted malty dark chocolate finish with some hints of coffee and licorice in the aftertaste. A great beer!

Bottle. This is the greatest I have ever had. Creamy light brown good mostly lasting head. Black colour. Almost perfcet malty and hoppy aroma. taste is loaded with chocolate, licorice and especially vanilla. Power power power. Long perfect finish. Great creamy palate. I wonder if it ever will get better than this......
Bottle. Black colour with a huge light brown head and a good lacing. Powerful complex aroma and taste of rasted malts, coffee, licorice and port. Very, very good beer.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, alcohol, hops, chocolate and coffee. Notes of vanilla too. Astonishing

[2 years vintage - To celebrate my 1800th rating  Thanks a million yespr for making this happen!] Black with medium brown head. Sweet vinious aroma with notes of roasted malt, hops, whiskey, dark bitter chocolate and coffee. Sweet and hoppy flavor with whiskey, hard roasted malt, dark chocolate and coffee notes. Huge complexity and very well balanced. Ends with solid bitterness and warming alcohol.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2014 33 cL bottle, huge thanks for this to Jeppe and Mikkel - I sure dont mind sharing beers with you guys when this is what you got the opportunity to acquire in return - thanks! Pours totally black with a little dense tan head. Aroma is smooth chocolate, coffe and hard roasted malt, all lifted by a dense alcohol aroma. The alcohol is slight burning in the eyes. Flavour is smooth chocolate and dense coffee with a solid alcohol note. Nice lingering roasted note. Surprisingly still sweet flavoured too. Warming finish and a dense chocolate and coffee flavour keep lasting far into the finish.8-5-9-4-17

2014, 14.9%: From tap. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aroma is dark malty, chocolate and liqourice. Sweet, dense dark malty. Jam like fruity. Dense chocolate, vague smoked/tarish. Smooth dark malty. Bitter and sweet finish.8-5-8-5-17

Botella. Pitch black colour with a small light brown head leaving a fair lacing. Sweet vinious aroma with dark fruits, roasted malt, alcohol and a mild whisky touch. Great sticky mouthfeel. Sweet flavour with dark fruits, roasted malt, roasted caramel, lots of bitter hops, alcohol and some choco.

Bottle. [thank you, Yespr]
[at Yeprs tuesday tasting]
Pours pitch black with a rather small, creamy brown head. Okay lacing, big blotches with short duration. Aroma is very powerful. Lightly roasted, subdued coffee, very light oxidation, vinious and some chocolate. Low carbonation, very nice oily palate. Pretty vinious, bordering on alcoholic. Quite sweet and sticky, some peity smoke, heavily roasted and a bit of soy sauce. A touch of dry cocoa at the end. Quite sweet and very vinious, but this is still miles ahead of the 2007 version.

Pours dark brown with a thin tan head.  Smells of chocolate, sugar, some roasted malt, lots of alcohol.  Tastes roasty and very sweet with some accompanying bitterness and assaulting alcohol.  I had this alongside Dark Horizon and Dark Horizon literally blew it out of the water.  I dont get the high ratings on this one.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2013 Bottle at home - shared with Mette. To celebrate my new job at H. Lundbeck !! Black black black - light brown head. High chokolate, high malty, nice high a bit sharp hoppy, berries, red berries, light coffee, creamy, light wood, dryness, roasted, light light sweetness, wineous, is it brett ?? It is not luckily too sweet as many other strong beers. - Almost no taste of alcohol. This is fantastic !!

black, fine tan head, drippy tan lace, big hot roasted malt aroma with lots of citrus hops and a woody character plus a touch of dark fruit, big creamy body, rich chocolate and roasted flavor, touch of tart cherry, well balanced bitterness combines with the roasted for a long bitter finish, neither sweet nor dry just very rich with a flavor that lasts and lasts, the chocolate keeps getting richer and richer

Shared at the C-Bus 7.  Dark beer with a whispy beige head.  Chalky nose with dark ripe pit fruit and alcohol.  This is a different stout.  Lots of molassess, brown sugar, wood, rum soaked vanilla beans and an odd smoked meat taste that went away as it warmed.  Lots of wood and alcohol, and Im guessing the background flavor that I sensed was that damned brett.  The 16% was present, but not intrusive.  Really interesting stout.

CT7 Bottle shared by moejuck via papsoe, thanks to all those involed! Black pour with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, vinous elements, and some oak. Flavors of dark chocolate, oak, bourbon and vinous qualities. Thick mouthfeel, soft carboantion...boozey and bittersweet with a dry finish.

Bottle thanks to moejuck and spector at Columbus tasting. Poured pitch black. Aroma of dark fruits, malt, sugary, brown sugar, and maybe a light sournesss. Flavor was huge with a real big body, licorice and very complex.

Bottle from Papsoe, shared at C-bus 7.  This was supposed to be the highlight of the evening, but I was extrememly dissapointed with this beer.  The aroma is a monster shot of sugar, alcohol, and some earthy scents.  The appearance was deep black with a thin head.  Medium palate is creamy, but not quite as full as many other imperials out there.  The taste is just too damn sweet!  Over the top amount of sugar, with tastes of licorice, roasted malts, and floral aspects as well.  The taste is very complex to be sure--but that doesnt make this a beer I would want to drink on a regular basis at all.  The overpowering sweetness of this stout ruins the web of flavors that are being presented, and make what Im sure could be an interesting experience a hollow one.

12oz bottle shared at columbus tasting 7 - Pours black with a short tan head that stays briefly. Aromas of big floral hops over chocolate and coffee.  Flavor reveals much much more.  Big chocolate, black licorice, coffee, smoke, lots of woody notes and some definite alcohol early on.  Later the alcohol seemed much more covered though.  Palate was oily, smooth and they did a pretty good job of covering up the alcohol in this monster.

Sweet malt,floral hops and alcohol stood out in the aroma.Pours very dark brown with a very thin tan head.Alcohol,black licorice,and some floral hops dominated the flavor.Medium to full mouthfeel with a lot of alcohol coming through in the finish.

Huge thanks to Moejuck and Spector for busting their ass to acquire this beer!!  THis beer was prolly the biggest disappointment of the night.  The aroma had alcohol lots of flowers and floral notes and even picked up a little bit of soapyiness or perfume.  The flavor was actually quite complex with a lot going on but I just really did not think it was worthy of its praises.  There was some licorice and dark fruits, but the most dominant thing was sugar and alcohol...and I just couldnt get much out of it past that because they were so prominent.  Overall very happy I was able to try it, but sadly I was seriously let down.

C-Bus 7 Bottle shared by moejuck via papsoe: Pours black with a tan head. Aroma, alcohol, chocolate, lots of dark fruits, floral, some brown sugar. Flavor, licorice, chocolate, dark fruits, some spice, and a slight funk to it. Very complex flavor, medium bodied, but it felt a little on the hot side for me. Still very enjoyable.

12 Oz Bottle shared by cquiroga. A funk of blue goat cheese, blueberries right from the canadian shield, and a musk of black malt. Im loving the lacto cheese character, while it could be construed as stinky. Pours deep black with a tan rim. More roquefort in the flavor, with tannic malt, cream, blackberry reduction and some roasted astringency. Ripe, is one word to use. An astounding 16% is lost amongst the sedimentary layers of inducing one too many angles of an Imperial Stout. Hops seems lost, despite profession from the bottle that the Pacific Northwest had a big influence. Its hard to climb over the mountain of funk that stamps this beer with its hard to achieve uniqueness. Dark rum clambors with balsamic for a final grapple to dominate a complex flavor profile. A long awaited and pleasently surprising opportunity to taste the enigmatic beast. Keep bringing it Danes!

From a 33cL Bottle.  Pours a viscous, oily black color with a thin layer of creamy tan head.  The aroma is intense.  Lots of sweet, sugary chocolate syrup, doused with molasses and anise, and fuming with a funky wave of rochefort cheese.  The lacto is very prominent and creates a bit of a pungent sensation when combined with the high alpha hops and noticeable alcohol content.  Everything is going on, and its all overwhelming to the senses.  Full bodied, lightly carbonated mouthfeel.  The flavors start out on the sweet side, brimming with more sugary chocolates and sweet molasses.  Rounding the corner, some notes of tobacco and well-trodden leather start to dry it up a bit.  At the finish, tons of funk and musty cheese are left lingering indefinitely on the palate.  As a reference point, this is what I would expect mephistopheles stout to taste like if it was aged in a barrel filled with gorgonzola cheese.  Theres just so much of everything going on, sticky malts, anise spice, leather, and some really funky cheese, my senses are met with more than their match.  I cower in the corner.  As expected from the description, a highly unique, interesting, and thought provoking beer, but its just too much to be one of my favorites.  Thanks a ton for sharing, Chris!
(KEG) Very black colour with a creamy head. Roasted, fruity and sweet aroma. Nice powerful flavour of fruit, alcohol, a little chocolate and coffee. Worldclass beer!

Bottle thanks Papsoe: Pours a viscous completely opaque black with a small froth of nicely-lacing brown head.  Aroma has some complex dark chocolate and caramel maltiness with big grapefruity hops, but has some tart dark cherries that seem out of place.  Starts with a thick, sticky sweet dark caramel malty body with some tobacco, brown sugar and plum complexity.  Some lactic tartness shows up toward the finish along with mild warmth and a lingering dark chocolate cherry flavor long after swallowing.  Would make a great imperial stout, except for the mild tartness.  Take away the lacto bacteria and this would be one of the best beers Ive ever had.

Poured black with a small creamy brown head.    The aroma is huge and thick.  Big roasted sweet malt, chocolate, sugar,  and vinous aged malt character.  The flavor is also full.  Vinous mildly tart flavor (read the description after about the wild bugs which is obviosuly  where this comes from)  Man the flavor is so huge.  Roast, chocolate, sweetness, fruit but for 16% no alcohol flavor.  But a ton of warmth.  Full bodied.  The flavor is still just as full 10 minutes after the last sip.  I would like to see how the Brett changes the beer over time.  But sadly it is gone.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2008 12 oz bottle shared by Fordest. Thank-you. I am not a huge fan of this style, but after this one, I think I could be. The problem with this style for me, I need to be hungry. Very fulfilling, tasted chocholate, coffee, cherries, Very Good!!!!

12 oz bottle huge thanks to sk8viking.  Blackest pour with nice creamy head.  Aromas of fruityiness and chocolate.  Cherries and hits of strawberries.  Flavors were intesely fruity for the style.  More cherry up front with chocolate and anise on the finish.  Then a nice bite on the aftertaste.. Simply wonderful.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2007 2 different bottles, both incredible. For almost fifteen years I have waited for a stout like this. Black pour with brilliant mahogany hues. A small but fervent head is totally resistant to diminishing. This looks like the inside of La Brea. A bouquet of varied anise scents lead in the aroma. Alcohol is very noticeable but somehow pleasing and cushiony. Sugar cane(Cachaca), rum raisin cake and a heaping of fresh cream. Really brutish nuances. Flavor is perfect, the first time Ive ever encountered the true meaning of the word. Cachaca and cream at first. Molasses that shows up next is confronting. Coconut cream mingles with alcohol and very bitter chocolate. The palate is gracious but unforgiving, completely full of vibrancy and as heavy as an anvil. Finishes roasty, chocolatey and without a complaint in the world from these lips. This is emminently complex, something to ponder over, which I suspect Ill be doing for many years to come. This is the most uncompromising and beautiful culinary delight I have ever had the pleasure of sampling. A near perfect stout. Maybe it is perfect, Ive certainly never had better. Thank you Mikkeller.

Courtesy of Papsoe. The body is deep black and holds a huge; two fingers thick, mocha head that is so thick and lasting it almost looks like it is brooding. The aroma is a alcohol, chocolate and cane sugar. Its kind of muddy and a bit of a let down, but good enough to want to get to drinking it sooner rather than later. The fore is rich chocolate, massive burnt and roast bitterness, stewed dark fruits and a mélange of espresso blueberry liqueur and an oily coffee like acidity. This  is a great Imperial Stout from the first sip, but that sip then attacks with a burst of very unusual flavors I have never in this combinationmolasses, cane sugar, raisin liqueur, burnt rum and apples and raisins friend in rum. This beer tastes like what Avery Mephistopheles SHOULD have tasted like and the Mephistopheles was very good.  The mouthfeel is thick and round. The last sip seemed to have grains of raw cane sugar in it. It was that thick and coarse. I can truly say no beer I have ever had tastes like this. It tastes like a great Imperial Stout with a great experimental Imperial Stout tacked on to it. This beer must be made again for the sake of beer geekdom.

Bottle thanks to Dr. J. Wow. Pitch black with a small brown head. Roasted and malty with notes af dark fruits, coffee, dark bitter chocolate and hops. Very round. Flavour almost like a barleu wine. Yum!

this was freakin awesome.  thanks johnc!  lots of roasted malt, roasted nuts in the aroma, some marshmallow, lots of chocolate, some dark cherry and raisin flavors and aroma.  freakin awesome.  PS the pour was absolutely beautiful.  almost looked like a nitro pour with tan very thick creamy head and a black bodice.  yum
A huge thanks to sk8viking for this great beer. A complex fruity (cherry/berry) highlighted flavor accentuates the stout roastiness and chocolate.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2007 This was one of the best imp.stouts i ever had ,sweet and powerful,great flavors and a lot of alcohol, hops,cocoa and malty.Bottle obtain from friend who went to denmark and brought some really tasty stuff.CHEERS!

Black beer with medium-sized dark greige head. Alcoholic, very vinous nose; dry, resiny-hoppy, lupulin powder. Concentrated coffee, cacao, tobacco, dark chocolate, hops (and quite a lot , and very good ones, at that). Alcohol is there - unmistakably - but the complex flavours onslaught is such that nobody in his right mind would guess the truth. It is vinous but in away no wine could venture there - not anymore than a halberd-armed warrior could imagine himself the katana bearing samurai. Palate: are you kidding? this is the absolute zero Kelvin concentrate of dark matter, hidden in the black neutron star. The most surprising - and if anything, the real "strength" of this beer is that it is, without doubt, BEER. Nobody would mistake if for anything else, notwithstanding its overpowering strength. Its what it claims to be: hidden strength instead of intimidation. Jeppe, Mikkel (and co-brewer) and Carlo, thank you for this incredible closing of 2006!

Bottle and my #200, what a way to celebrate the last day of 2006. BIG thanks to Mikkel for letting me try this nectar of the gods! Initial pour displayed gloomy liquid with a three finger head. Initial colour of head was brown and creamy like. Longevity was mostly diminishing, but left thick wallpaper like lacing. Bouquet was so complex with an arrangement of pheromone that left you breathless for some minutes.just sniffing away, waiting for the initial first sip. Here it comes.wow talk about complexity in aroma. Initial thought was very vinous with notes of heavy malt and hops. Notes of dark candies, nutty, grapefruit, molasses, chocolate, coffee, dry fruit and smoke hits the taste buds. What a palate with a full bodied feel and an oily texture. Mouth is covered in oily from top to bottom in the most pleasing way imaginable. That said, there is still some dryness to be felt, especially at the end of a sip. Some where in there is the warmth of 16% alcohol, but you never really feel the alcohol, it is so well hidden. Carbonation is soft. Initial flavour is moderated to heavy sweet but exceptionally balanced bitter as well. Finish is sweet and longgggggggg lasting. I really cant praise this beer enough, amazing Imperial Stout, properly the best so fare in my short time at RB. Happy New Year all ratebeerians!

Tar black beer with big brown foamy head. Powerful aroma of rubber, chocolate and black coffee. This beer has a strange sharpness that goes wel with the roasted, toasted and burned caracter of this beer. The taste is like nothing I ever tasted before.  Super concentrated coffee, dark sugars, black and bitter chocolate and pine needles. All this concentration is accentuated by a sour lemon like sharpness. There is an interesting dosis of hops and pine needles in the afthertaste.
Bottle at Horsens beerfestival. Black colour with a brown head. Aroma is lacerice, malt, coffee, alcohol. Flavour is lacerice, coffee, alcohol, chocolate, hop. A VERY nice beer.

[Another century celebrated with a Mikkeller beer - this time 7200] Man, Ive been looking forward to sampling this beer again - ever since I tried first time draft at Københavnske Øldage in May 2006 - and now Im sipping a bottled version. The rating is a mixture of the two impressions.A pitch black beer with a lazing dark brown head. The aroma is very hoppy - like sticking your head in a hop vine in late August, but it also has notes of grapes, grass, grapefruit, and lesser notes of chocolate and oranges. The flavor is very powerful and very sweet, with notes of hops, brown sugar, grapefruit, chocolate, syrup, and lemon, toward the end a slight bret like acidity comes along. The end is roasted dry combined with a sharp citrus hop note. The mouthfeel is velvety soft, and the body very powerful, and the texture like syrup. This is the perfect sipping beer - Im going to contemplate the meaning of life while finishing this - and then Im going to have a healty and deep night of sleep. I want more even though I know it is impossible to remake.

Draught. Black with enormous brown head. Aroma of pine, grass, clover, forrest and meadow. The flavour is full of a lot of the good stuff, I want in a beer like this and plenty more: pine, hops, sweetness, licorice, tobacco, dark fruits and warmth from the alcohol. Thick palate! I pleaded with Jeppe to get one more of these from him via mail, but the bastard brother of Mikkel never took notice! Now hes out my will and Mikkel and Keller will inherit all (if they can actually start a regular production of this baby!)
Bottle at Horsens Ølfestival. Nice brown head. An aroma of citrusfriut (lemon?). very nice at taste!  some sweets, sweet chocolat, hops, and coffee. Can i have one more, plz?

Bottled at Horsens Beerfestival. It looks as the original sin, topped off by a small brown head. The aroma is just wonderful, with chocolate, black tea, tobacco, alcohol, beef-stock notes and lots of hops. Not unbalanced though. It has a hint of sourness in the flavor, along with alcohol, chocolate, tea, mocha, hops and all things good. Full body with a drying sensation. It finishes off with alcohol, hops and coffee-bitterness. Theres also some lactic notes all the way, not to talk of the nice aromas and flavors from the hops. A wonderful beer that deserves a better faith than just beeing an experiment. Thx for the tasting Mikkel & Kristian. (061028)

Draught at KØ 2006. Pours pitch black with a brown head. Aroma is sweetish sour, lots of hops, some roasted malts. Taste is surprisingly hoppy, roasted. Fullbodied moutfeel, and a long bitter roasted aftertaste. This is a wild beer.
